Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2018 04:39PM - edited Feb 15, 2018 05:14PM by Sharrose I just wanted to share, I have had nausea after radiation treatments to my left breast the entire time. It starts 15-30 min after treatment, It is mild but last an hour or two. I have had no other side effects. My doctor said, he has had only two out of fifty patients with this but our description is the same. He said he would now include it in his list of possible side effects. I have just two more treatments to go out of 35.
Posts.Title: Radiation causing nausea and dizziness marymary897 Motherofall6

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2017 11:31AM Sharrose wrote: I had biopsy on the 8th and was told the ninth I have cancer left breast. But I know absolutely nothing else. I have appointment with surgeon the 20th and sometime after that the oncologist. My journey started with being called back for sonogram May 31st.

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2017 11:05AM Sharrose wrote: I have 2 Invasive Ductal Carcinomas, Triple Negative Cancer. Grade 3. The Surgeon is requesting 2 more biopsies on 2 other places of concern. It looks like I will be doing chemo for 6 months before surgery.but I still have to see the oncologist and they want to see if I can get a genetic testing. Lots of fact gethering on this first few weeks of this journey.
